title: structure view performance degrades with large column count
body: while the content view for large tables performs better than any other postgres app, the structure view performance degrades noticeably for tables with more than 40 columns. Adding additional columns takes longer for each new column. To reproduce just create a new table and hit the `+ Column` button a bunch of times. After `column50` it takes 3 seconds on my macbook air for the new column to appear, after `column70` the app starts to beachball for a while.

title: Postico hangs when a query returns many results/notices
body: Postico can take a long time to process results and notices. The problem becomes noticable around 1000 results or notices.  Switching between results is also slow when the query has returned many results.

title: Syntax highlighting doesn't work inside dollar quoted strings
body: Postico should also highlight code inside dollar quoted strings, eg:  ``` DO LANGUAGE plv8 $$ plv8.elog(NOTICE, 'test') //this code is not highlighted $$; ```

title: Saved query sidebar tree
body: Love the UI as it is (best I've seen yet!) but have one suggestion (maybe it's more of a dream): It would be quite useful to have a directory tree similar to Sublime Text's sidebar directory tree, to simplify the 'Load Query' step. Could specify a root folder from Preferences and selecting a .sql file within one of its expandable child directories would load that to the query console...  ![screen shot 2015-06-23 at 9 41 03 am](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3866184/8311579/02de830a-198c-11e5-913b-699ad53645ed.png)  Not entirely necessary, but would be a pretty great 'nice to have' (:

title: Usability of favorites window degrades as more connections are added
body: The current favorite window layout is only usable up to a relatively small number of saved connections.  I work as a freelancer and have a lot of connections to various client's databases saved. I'm currently at 22 favorites (and those are only the most active clients and projects) and it's already getting aggravating to find the correct one, even with a very strict naming scheme.  For the short term I'd suggest adding the possiblity to search / filter the favorites. Longer term I'd be very happy about a folder or tag based favorites system.

title: Cmd-A should not select SQL Query
body: When hitting Cmd-A, all objects, including SQL Query, are selected. This doesn't really make sense, since there are no operations (like Delete, Truncate) that could be performed on it.

title: Postico slow when dealing with text fields.
body: I have a one table which has no issue dealing with 1000 rows and another that does. The one that does have issues has a `text` field that can get quite large.  I also notice that when I hover over those `text` fields, `postico` tries to give me a preview of it, and I don't think that it's of a cut down version.  If I were to guess what the issue is, it might be that the contents of `text` field are involved somewhere in the creation of the result table and it's slowing things down. I could be wrong though and it could just be shortening 1000 potentially very large `text` fields that's the issue, but either way, I feel like it has something to do with `text` fields.

I also notice that when I hover over those `text` fields, `postico` tries to give me a preview of it, and I don't think that it's of a cut down version.

If I were to guess what the issue is, it might be that the contents of `text` field are involved somewhere in the creation of the result table and it's slowing things down. I could be wrong though and it could just be shortening 1000 potentially very large `text` fields that's the issue, but either way, I feel like it has something to do with `text` fields.

title: Export using SQL insert
body: Would be great to be able to export a table using SQL inserts. Right now only CSV seems to be available. Copy Special is great, but works only for the selected rows, not for whole tables.  Or if SQL inserts are hard to implement, perhaps just importing CSV would be nice. How I do it now: `COPY table FROM 'xxxx.csv' DELIMITER ',' CSV;`

Or if SQL inserts are hard to implement, perhaps just importing CSV would be nice.

title: Allow Changing Font Size
body: It should be possible to change the fonts and font sizes used.  There probably need to be settings for two fonts: - "Data font" used in Table View - "SQL font" used in Query View etc.

- "SQL font" used in Query View etc.

title: pg Commander-style Detail View
body: One thing I love about pg Commander is the detail view - being able to double click a record and have it take up the full window to edit with foreign key references is great. It's the first thing I show people when I see them using still using pgAdmin.  The Detail Sidebar on the right in Postico doesn't do that justice. I had a look through the menus and options but didn't see a way to restore the old behaviour. Not sure how difficult that might be, but adding an option to go back to that rather than the inline view with the detail sidebar would be awesome  Thanks for the great work!
data:
{"id": 101402534, "url": "https://api.github.com/repos/jakob/Postico/issues/48", "body": "One thing I love about pg Commander is the detail view - being able to double click a record and have it take up the full window to edit with foreign key references is great. It's the first thing I show people when I see them using still using pgAdmin.

The Detail Sidebar on the right in Postico doesn't do that justice. I had a look through the menus and options but didn't see a way to restore the old behaviour. Not sure how difficult that might be, but adding an option to go back to that rather than the inline view with the detail sidebar would be awesome

Thanks for the great work!

title: Filter button at the bottom should open a filter section close to the button
body: I believe this came with the very last 0.26 release but now when I click on filter it opens a section at the top. This leads me to go to the very bottom to click filter, then go all the way to the top to put in my filter. Prior to this the filter was at the bottom close to the button. I'd say either move the button up for the section back down  ![screenshot 2015-08-17 15 08 31](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/125599/9313613/deefc6f2-44f1-11e5-9f36-2e0d6308c8eb.png)  This shows the filter button at the bottom, a table inbetween and the filter section on top of it. Less pronounced when I have it all squished like this but expanding it out a bit or full screen it's a much bigger deal.

title: Bytea data type slows down postico
body: We have a table with a bytea column to store big images (about 44 MB per image). Now every time I retrieve data form this table with postico (f.g. clicking on the table name), the application hangs till the 44 MB per row is loaded from the database.  ![capturfiles_67](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5220162/9519424/e5a47842-4cbe-11e5-95ac-cac3f1bed231.png)  It would be great to have an option to disable bytea loading and only load it if the user is requesting it.
data:
{"id": 103487880, "url": "https://api.github.com/repos/jakob/Postico/issues/57", "body": "We have a table with a bytea column to store big images (about 44 MB per image). Now every time I retrieve data form this table with postico (f.g. clicking on the table name), the application hangs till the 44 MB per row is loaded from the database.

![capturfiles_67](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5220162/9519424/e5a47842-4cbe-11e5-95ac-cac3f1bed231.png)

It would be great to have an option to disable bytea loading and only load it if the user is requesting it.

title: Add Quick Look support to entries
body: It'd be cool if Postico offered a Quick Look feature, similar to Xcode's Quick Look support in the debugger. For example, if I preview a latitude / longitude coordinate pair, I'd get a map of the location in a popover. If I preview an image URL, I'd see the image in a popover.

title: Be able to modify SQL query from a filtered view
body: I'm viewing a table, I might have applied a filter now I want to do something more complex (a join, an aggregation etc)  I'm looking for a way to see and edit the SQL query for the current view.  At the moment I have to go to the SQL Query view and type the whole query out, which isn't very productive, especially with long table names.

title: Be able to export from a table view
body: If you go to SQL Query mode and search for data there's an export button.  If you view a table there is no export button.  It'd be awesome to have the export button in both places!  I'd also really like to be able to highlight a selection of rows to export, just like in SQL Query mode.

title: a more obivious way of closing the filter bar
body: It took me a while to figure out how to close the filter bar (cmd + f).  Maybe a small (x) button in the top right would be helpful it should clear the filter and close the bar. Also the input field for the filter term open the spelling corrections when hitting <esc> like in #2.

title: ssh timeout option in preferences
body: I usually leave all my windows open when going from home from work. When I want to use the app again it takes about 60 seconds for postico to realise that the connection is gone and to reconnect. This is most likely due to the ssh session stalling and maybe there could be a preference to adjust this.  That is if there is a way at all for you to control this. I don't think there is a timeout value that would be a great fit for everybody, since it depends on your connection and general network flakiness, so a preference might be a good fit.
data:
{"id": 105631376, "url": "https://api.github.com/repos/jakob/Postico/issues/66", "body": "I usually leave all my windows open when going from home from work. This is most likely due to the ssh session stalling and maybe there could be a preference to adjust this.

I don't think there is a timeout value that would be a great fit for everybody, since it depends on your connection and general network flakiness, so a preference might be a good fit.

title: Page number can be greater than number of pages in table content view
body: When using localhost connection host for postico, ssh'ing to a different db connection with the same tables but different content and refreshing postico can lead to this bug. ie- DB 1 and 2 have same schema, but DB 2 doesn't have all the data DB 1 has. This is the case in the attached screenshot. Refreshing after connecting to DB 2 from DB 1 while on page 3 keeps me on page 3, though there are not enough rows for page 3 to be available otherwise.

title: "Copy INSERT statement" - insert into 'table_name'
body: "Copy insert statement" command creates incorrect insert statements: 'Insert into "table_name"...' It is always "table_name" instead of actual table name.

title: Add support for editing functions (stored procedures)
body: Multiple users have requested a way to edit stored procedures/functions in Postico.  I'm not currently working on this feature, but I do plan to add it at some point in the future.  Please post a comment if this would be useful for you.

title: Show dependent objects in delete dialog sheet
body: It would be great if the dialog box would show the dependent objects in the delete dialog. It should be possible to get the dependance tree from the `pg_depend` sys catalog. The dialog should only show the cascade option if at least one object depends on the db-object. It should also display the number of dependent objects and have a toggle switch to list these.  I think such a feature would prevent some unintentional `DROP CASCADES` and would be greatly appreciated.

{"id": 107906891, "url": "https://api.github.com/repos/jakob/Postico/issues/77", "body": "It would be great if the dialog box would show the dependent objects in the delete dialog.

The dialog should only show the cascade option if at least one object depends on the db-object.
It should also display the number of dependent objects and have a toggle switch to list these.

I think such a feature would prevent some unintentional `DROP CASCADES` and would be greatly appreciated.

title: Pretty print JSON by default?
body: More often then not I want to read the JSON inside the fields. And I'm not storing indentation to save space. Right now there is the Pretty Print JSON option, but I have to click it for every row/field and it changes the field which is rarely what I actually want to do.   One negative aspect of this could be: If the JSON field is pretty printed by default and it's not what you have in the DB it could create confusion. Since only whitespace changes, I wouldn't expect much confusion though. I would love an option to show JSON pretty-printed by default.

title: Recommendation for quick view of table schema
body: I find myself a lot wanting to check the table structure for a column name and it's relatively easy in PGAdmin (switch back to the main window) but it's less easy in Postico: I think what might be ideal is something like:  1) a preference to show either table content or structure by default (it's always content) 2) and maybe some quick way of viewing the table structure rather than immediately editing it?  Anyway, just some quicker way of accessing the view of the table would be great.

title: Can't widen last column in grid view
body: I can't seem to get a handle on widening the last column in the table records view so I can read the name of the column.  Instead it widens the window without widening the column.  Furthermore, two fingered dragging pulling back the last view is super annoying.  Stop doing that.  I'm trying to get to the end of my record, not go back to the last table view.

title: a dot should be a word-boundary when using <alt> + <left> or <alt> + <right>
body: I sometimes try to select the table name without the schema (or vice-versa) using `<alt> + <shift> + <left | right>`, but I always end up selecting the table name and the schema. Double clicking correctly recognises the dot as a word boundary and selects only the schema or the table name.

title: Postico never finishes connecting to a database
body: Connecting to our 'production' database never completes - we see "Connecting" in the status bar, a spinner at the bottom right, but only "SQL Query" in the main window display. Connecting to different databases on the same server works pretty much instantly (including databases that are older clones of the non-responding database). We can successfully connect to the non-responding database using PgAdminIII so it looks to be Postico-related.  We'd be happy to provide logging info if available...?

title: <cmd + R> should not close open schemas in the sidebar
body: Every time I create a table through the sql editor and reload the sidebar with <cmd + R> all the opened schemas are getting closed, which gets a bit annoying over time. It would be nice if  a) the open/close states of the schemas in the sidebar would remain stable across reloads b) `CREATE`, `DROP` and maybe `ALTER` statements would automatically invalidate the corresponding schema and table information

title: Custom Actions - make Postico extendable with scripts
body: It would be great if predefined custom SQL queries (snippets) could be executed in context of specific objects such as databases, tables and columns. I would envisage list of possible snippets/actions exposed in a context menu as per the below image.  ![postico_actions](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/934664/10824523/af711886-7e58-11e5-9fa1-6b07dcc32599.png)  Let's say I would add the following snippet to the app, which I can use to duplicate a database:  ``` sql -- Create a new database using the given database as a template CREATE DATABASE "{{database}}_new" TEMPLATE = "{{database}}" ```  Here the `{{database}}` placeholder is a parameter to be replaced by the database name I have clicked on. The Postico would be clever enough to detect the `{{database}}` placeholder in the code and automatically offer the action in the context menu for databases.  Selecting such an action from the context menu could either bring the SQL editor with the pre-populated query with the placeholder parameters replaced appropriately or execute the query and show the result right away. Perhaps, there could be a checkbox for each custom SQL query to define this behaviour.  Having this feature would remove the burden of maintaining lists of SQL code snippets in files on the disk or in a separate app. Also, this would allow Postico to be extended with many missing features quite easily (such as listing sequences in the database).  Here's another example of such a snippet, which could be used in the context of a table column:  ``` sql -- Show records for which the given column is not a valid email address SELECT * FROM {{database}}.{{table}} WHERE {{column}} !~ '^[A-Za-z0-9._%-]+@[A-Za-z0-9.-]+[.][A-Za-z]+$' ```
data:
{"id": 114095916, "url": "https://api.github.com/repos/jakob/Postico/issues/105", "body": "It would be great if predefined custom SQL queries (snippets) could be executed in context of specific objects such as databases, tables and columns. I would envisage list of possible snippets/actions exposed in a context menu as per the below image.

![postico_actions](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/934664/10824523/af711886-7e58-11e5-9fa1-6b07dcc32599.png)

Let's say I would add the following snippet to the app, which I can use to duplicate a database:

``` sql
-- Create a new database using the given database as a template
CREATE DATABASE "{{database}}_new"
TEMPLATE = "{{database}}"
```

Here the `{{database}}` placeholder is a parameter to be replaced by the database name I have clicked on. The Postico would be clever enough to detect the `{{database}}` placeholder in the code and automatically offer the action in the context menu for databases.

Selecting such an action from the context menu could either bring the SQL editor with the pre-populated query with the placeholder parameters replaced appropriately or execute the query and show the result right away. Perhaps, there could be a checkbox for each custom SQL query to define this behaviour.

Having this feature would remove the burden of maintaining lists of SQL code snippets in files on the disk or in a separate app. Also, this would allow Postico to be extended with many missing features quite easily (such as listing sequences in the database).

Here's another example of such a snippet, which could be used in the context of a table column:

``` sql
-- Show records for which the given column is not a valid email address
SELECT * FROM {{database}}.{{table}}
WHERE {{column}} !~ '^[A-Za-z0-9._%-]+@[A-Za-z0-9.-]+[.][A-Za-z]+$'
```

title: cannot uncomment lines inside function bodies
body: uncommenting lines in the text editor (`<cmd + / >`) doesn't work if the cursor (or selection) is inside a function body:  ``` CREATE "my_func"() RETURNS VOID AS $$   -- RAISE NOTICE 'try uncommenting me';   RETURN; $$; ```

title: Is it possible to search by JSONB field?
body: Hello Jakob!  I like to use JSONB field in some tables and search by them. For example, I have a table `products` with some required fields (like `cost`, `quantity`, `name`) and one additional JSONB field `properties` where I can push any JSON data (for TV it can be `screen_size` and for `car` it can be `wheels_size`).  I don't know is Portico have support of querying this typeof fields? For example, I need to select all products with `screen_size=15` and `product_type=TV`. How to do this in Portico?  Thank you.
data:
{"id": 114796914, "url": "https://api.github.com/repos/jakob/Postico/issues/110", "body": "Hello Jakob!

I don't know is Portico have support of querying this typeof fields? For example, I need to select all products with `screen_size=15` and `product_type=TV`. How to do this in Portico?

Thank you.

title: Option to set default schema in login information
body: With multi tenancy our default schema is 'public'. It would be nice if we could set that default schema to something else. This way you could have different 'Favorite' connection preferences for different schemas.  ![schema_wireframe](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1372520/11011784/bbb5718e-84a0-11e5-9613-43d0c10ca1ff.png)

title: small usability issue: Result 1 to Query Status
body: I often check the query status view to see notifications, etc, and find it a little frustrating to click the Result 1 drop-down and select it. Would it be possible to add a button that allows a quick toggle?  (i know, tiny, minor issue)

title: Better support for `bytea` type
body: Postico currently has only limited support for `bytea` columns. Postico can display images stored in bytea columns in the sidebar, but apart from that there is no way to look at the data.  I've just discussed some ideas with @apeiros, who uses bytea columns to store textual data that may contain invalid code points. He suggested that the data should be displayed directly in the table view, in one of the following formats: 1. ascii with escape sequences, eg. `hello\x00w\xc3\xb6rld` 2. hex, eg. `0x68656c6c6f0077c3b6726c64` 3. utf-8, eg. `hello\x00wrld`  It would be nice if Postico did some auto-detection to display data in a sensible way (eg. don't try to display images as text), and also allow the user to view data in a specific way.  I'd love to hear feedback on this. Do people actually use the bytea type? And what kind of data do you store inside?
data:
{"id": 117902616, "url": "https://api.github.com/repos/jakob/Postico/issues/128", "body": "Postico currently has only limited support for `bytea` columns. Postico can display images stored in bytea columns in the sidebar, but apart from that there is no way to look at the data.

I've just discussed some ideas with @apeiros, who uses bytea columns to store textual data that may contain invalid code points. He suggested that the data should be displayed directly in the table view, in one of the following formats:
1. ascii with escape sequences, eg. `hello\x00w\xc3\xb6rld`
2. hex, eg. `0x68656c6c6f0077c3b6726c64`
3. utf-8, eg. `hello\x00wrld`

It would be nice if Postico did some auto-detection to display data in a sensible way (eg. don't try to display images as text), and also allow the user to view data in a specific way.

I'd love to hear feedback on this. Do people actually use the bytea type? And what kind of data do you store inside?

title: multi line mode
body: I did a quick search and didn't see this - sorry if this is a duplicate.  For editing sql another must-have feature is multi line mode.  My fav sql client Universal SQL Editor (http://mingsoftware.com/universalsqleditor, windows only unfortunately) does this with a simple Shift+Alt and arrow key select. Sublime Text multi line selections work well too but are probably more powerful than is really necessary.  For some reason Navicat has been really unstable lately so I've moved to using postico for browsing my db, it is looking pretty good.

title: Various structure editing UI features
body: here is a grab bag of small UI issues related to the structure view: - [ ] the delete button is very far away from the column name. Thus marking the right column for deletion can be hit and miss if the windows is big and there a a lot of columns. The button could be relocated or the column (or just the button) could be highlight while the mouse cursor is hovering over the column - [ ] multi column primary keys should be represented in the constraints section - [ ] indices could also have a section in the columns list; they could also have a colour coding so that multi column indices could be easily identified and the columns and index definition could easily be related - [x] the column/content toggle button should not be reset if the table is changed. If I'm editing a table structure I am also likely to check/edit the table structure of another table. The current design makes this process quite tedious  - [ ] editing the type should bring up a small popup-window (like when editing foreign keys) with a dedicated `USING` field. While it's easy to use once you know that the `USING` clause can be written there, it is not very discoverable

title: Advanced sorting in table view
body: It would be awesome to be able to sort by multiple columns in Table View so that once it finished sorting the main column, you can then sort by a secondary column all of the items that have the same value, and so on for multiple columns. (Less important, it would also be great to be able to sort by functions/custom SQL, most notably `random()`).  Ideally it would be a implementation of the Data Sorting window in pgAdmin: ![screen shot 2015-11-24 at 1 33 26 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8130234/11376735/5e3122f6-92b0-11e5-98bf-334d7c476bf7.png)

title: Place cursor in Terminal on "Go To Terminal"
body: When the shift-apple-T hotkey is pressed to "Go To Terminal", the user still needs to click inside the box to place the cursor there. Please place the cursor in the terminal so the user can just start typing.

title: Provide plugin architecture so developers can register bundles for editing/displaying field types.
body: Provide a plugins folder where developers can drop in a bundle for a component that can edit a field type - editor should support single or list of values.  This would allow indy devs to add mapping components for postgis or master detail editors or styled text editors or whatever...

title: "Automatically disconnect when idle" should check for temp tables
body: I've run into an issue where one could potentially have unexpected data loss when working with temp tables. While it is perfectly logical, that some state could be lost,it can be unexpected. Disconnection on idle makes sense most of the time, but maybe there is a way for you to check if temp tables exist before cutting the connection.  Something similar probably is true for `SET` and especially for `SET search_path`, which might lead to a query unexpectedly failing after the user has been inactive. Maybe there is a way to save this state before disconnecting and re-establishing the connection with the same configuration.

title: `IN` as a filter option
body: It would be nice to have an `IN` filter as an option when filtering table data.  - for number like columns an input of `1,2,3` should lead to `"my_column" IN (1,2,3)` - for string like fields (including enums) an input of `foo,bar,3,'hello, you'` should lead to `"my_column" IN ('foo', 'bar', '3', 'hello, you')`  extra points: - autocompletion would be nice for enum columns (or a drop down menu for filter that only take one argument) - the little popover window for foreign keys could also be useful here when working with FK columns
data:
{"id": 121215960, "url": "https://api.github.com/repos/jakob/Postico/issues/144", "body": "It would be nice to have an `IN` filter as an option when filtering table data. 
- for number like columns an input of `1,2,3` should lead to `"my_column" IN (1,2,3)`
- for string like fields (including enums) an input of `foo,bar,3,'hello, you'` should lead to `"my_column" IN ('foo', 'bar', '3', 'hello, you')`

extra points:
- autocompletion would be nice for enum columns (or a drop down menu for filter that only take one argument)
- the little popover window for foreign keys could also be useful here when working with FK columns

title: Reloading fails when view was changed to a table
body: The interface in Postico doesn't refresh correctly when the type of object that is currently displayed changes. This can happen when the structure of a view is displayed, then you load a dump that deletes the view and creates a table with the same load, and then you reload in Postico.

title: Filter bar that stays or defaults to open
body: Since filtering is an activity I am constantly using, it's kind of annoying to have to go to the bottom of the window and turn on filters every time I change tables.   I'd love it if either there was a preference option to always have filters open, or perhaps if filters stayed open until you close them even when changing tables.  Keep up the good work!

title: Adding a column with a default value fails when connection is disconnected
body: Postico crashes when trying to add a column but the connection is disconnected.  This issue is exacerbated by the Auto-Disconnect feature. Disable automatic disconnect when idle in preferences as a workaround.

title: Feature request: query formatting
body: It would be nice to have query formatting button/hotkey SQLyog, Sequel Pro can do that (also see http://www.dpriver.com/pp/sqlformat.htm)  P.S. also https://github.com/TaoK/PoorMansTSqlFormatter (http://poorsql.com/), http://sqlformat.darold.net/, many more. part of them are opensource   P.P.S. https://github.com/darold/pgFormatter

title: alternative for "copy name" on tables/views in sidebar "copy qualified name"
body: It would be great to be able to copy a qualified version of a table/view name. i.e. instead of just copying `table_name` copying `"schema_name"."table_name"`.  This option could be shown in the context menu when pressing the alt/option button.

title: Make it possible to specify search_path for the connection favorite
body: I'd like to be able to create a favorite that automatically sets a specified search_path.  (Maybe this is already possible and I just missed it?)

title: Set multiple foreign key values to NULL or DEFAULT
body: Postico allows editing multiple rows at once using the sidebar. It is also possible to set values to NULL or DEFAULT by clicking the little arrow in the field. However, foreign key fields don't have this arrow.  We need a way to set foreign key values to NULL or DEFAULT

title: Dark UI Theme
body: Is it possible to have a Dark UI theme?  I have all of my development apps with dark themes to reduce eye strain, but Postico is one of the few apps that lights up my screen with a bright white background, and it is especially obvious (and painful) when switching between apps.

title: Export... vs. Export Selection...
body: UI suggestion: When any cell or row is selected, the 'Export' button currently switches to 'Export Selection'. Since these are two separate actions (and often I aim to export the entire table even after selecting a cell) I'd suggest retaining the Export button, even while a cell/row is selected.  ![screen shot 2016-01-25 at 12 29 34 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3866184/12563527/8c6045dc-c35f-11e5-98a8-2714f78bb354.png)  ![screen shot 2016-01-25 at 12 29 44 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3866184/12563534/905a9354-c35f-11e5-8cde-9895a2d59db0.png)

title: Executing multiple statements shouldn't stop on error
body: It seems when executing multiple statements and one of them encounters an error, the remaining statements are not executed. I believe the default behaviour should be that all statements are executed regardless of any errors.   That is how psql treats its input by default (could be changed by ON_ERROR_STOP parameter). The same does phpPgAdmin when executing a query. Adminer has an option "Stop on error", which is disabled by default.  I got caught up by this recently when I was running series of database queries which were wrapped in a transaction block (BEGIN; .... COMMIT;). An error in one of the queries stopped execution so the final COMMIT statement was't reached and the database wasn't rolled back into the pre-transaction state. Furthermore, being in the middle of failed transaction causes any Postico operations to fail until COMMIT is explicitly executed.

{"id": 130708096, "url": "https://api.github.com/repos/jakob/Postico/issues/174", "body": "It seems when executing multiple statements and one of them encounters an error, the remaining statements are not executed. That is how psql treats its input by default (could be changed by ON_ERROR_STOP parameter). The same does phpPgAdmin when executing a query. Adminer has an option "Stop on error", which is disabled by default.

I got caught up by this recently when I was running series of database queries which were wrapped in a transaction block (BEGIN; .... COMMIT;). An error in one of the queries stopped execution so the final COMMIT statement was't reached and the database wasn't rolled back into the pre-transaction state. Furthermore, being in the middle of failed transaction causes any Postico operations to fail until COMMIT is explicitly executed.

title: Easier way to select multiple databases
body: Right now you have to hold command or shift then click each one of them. You can not use shift and select a range, or use the mouse. This is a bit tiresome if you need to delete many databases.

title: improvements to the new row editor
body: two thing that could be improved for row editor (after hitting `+ Row`) are: - the keyboard focus always lands on the first column, but this is usually a serial/primary column. Giving the focus to the first column that has not a `DEFAULT` sequence or expression might be better - when the keyboard focus is on a column with a foreign key, the foreign key selector thing disapeares until the keyboard focus is lost

title: Refresh on return-to-foreground
body: I assume `AppKit` fires some kind of `NSNotification` when a window gets foregrounded -- d'you think it could be an enable-able feature to have Postico refresh the open table on foregrounding? Doesn't have to be enabled by default but could be enabled via preferences perhaps.

title: Update docs to mention need to update PK sequences when importing data to a table
body: When copying data from a source table to a target table, you may have to modify the table's primary key sequence so that the next insert doesn't violate the primary key constraint, as sequence state isn't carried over with the copy.  For example, if the highest primary key of the pasted data was 42, and the sequence was called "My_pk_seq", with a query such as:  `ALTER SEQUENCE "My_pk_seq" RESTART WITH 43;`  Just thought it might be a good idea to add this caveat to the "Importing and Exporting data in Postico" section of the user guide. Thanks for this great tool!
data:

For example, if the highest primary key of the pasted data was 42, and the sequence was called "My_pk_seq", with a query such as:

`ALTER SEQUENCE "My_pk_seq" RESTART WITH 43;`

Just thought it might be a good idea to add this caveat to the "Importing and Exporting data in Postico" section of the user guide. Thanks for this great tool!

title: Dismiss "Filter tables" on Enter
body: Currently pressing `Enter` while in "Filter Tables" mode does nothing.  I would suggest that it should simply dismiss the filter mode (and close the tables sidebar if it wasn't open before entering filter mode)

title: Feature Request: Should be able to Double-Click on a file and open the file on a default server
body: As a user, I want to be able to double click on a file to open it up on the server that I use most often, because I shouldn't have to go through 6 steps to open up a file.   (Open Postico, select server, click sql query, click load, click file name, click done)

title: Provide table CREATE scripts
body: It would be really handy to be able to copy out or save table CREATE scripts from the structure view - as is possible with views. I do this all the time in pgAdmin for various admin/loading tasks & would rather use Postico!

title: Breadcrumb button display quirk
body: The breadcrumb button width changes by +/-2px depending on its previous width.  It's a minor issue, but would be nice if fixed.

title: parenthetical highlighting would be a useful added feature in later releases
body: In the sql editor, it's easy to lose track of what parentheses are "matching pairs". It's really helpful when the cursor is on a parenthesis to be able to clearly see it's matching pair highlighted. Furthermore, it's nice when "unclosed" parentheses are highlighted for the user to know immediately that there's a parentheses problem. Pgadmin III has these features.  As far as I can tell this feature currently doesn't exist, but I think it would be a really powerful feature to add. Did me wonders in the pgadmin days.

title: Client connection parameters
body: Unless I've missed it, it appears to be impossible to supply client connection parameters (http://www.postgresql.org/docs/current/static/runtime-config-client.html). Being able to supply these would be particularly useful for making read-only connections with `default_transaction_read_only`.

title: ability to organize favorites?
body: Probably not an issue for most, but I have about 25 connections, and the straight list of favorites is a little unwieldy. Is there a way we can add favorite folders, or categories, or draw borders between favorites, or something to organize this a little better than just using a straight list?  Thanks!

title: Slow loading of table with large geometry objects
body: I have a table with 37 rows, each with a fairly large geometry. If I `SELECT * FROM _table_` it takes about 15s, but if I simply load the table from the Postico browser it takes more than 30s.  My guess is that Postico is selecting the geometry `ST_AsEWKT()`, which is slowing the query down. If I `SELECT *, ST_AsEWKT(geom) FROM _table_` the query takes approximately as long as Postico takes to load it.  I can see a few different solutions to this problem: 1. Simply select the binary geometry 2. If the geometry is requested and not transformed (either as a part of `*` or `SELECT geom`), return some sort of placeholder. Perhaps something like `<Geometry>` 3. Similar to number 2, but return the type of geometry with `SELECT GeometryType(geom)`  Thank you for creating such a great product!
data:
{"id": 152632711, "url": "https://api.github.com/repos/jakob/Postico/issues/212", "body": "I have a table with 37 rows, each with a fairly large geometry. If I `SELECT * FROM _table_` it takes about 15s, but if I simply load the table from the Postico browser it takes more than 30s.

My guess is that Postico is selecting the geometry `ST_AsEWKT()`, which is slowing the query down. If I `SELECT *, ST_AsEWKT(geom) FROM _table_` the query takes approximately as long as Postico takes to load it.

I can see a few different solutions to this problem:
1. Simply select the binary geometry
2. If the geometry is requested and not transformed (either as a part of `*` or `SELECT geom`), return some sort of placeholder. Perhaps something like `<Geometry>`
3. Similar to number 2, but return the type of geometry with `SELECT GeometryType(geom)`

Thank you for creating such a great product!
", "user": {"id": 1739551, "url": "https://api.github.com/users/jczaplew", "type": "User", "login": "jczaplew", "html_url": "https://github.com/jczaplew", "gists_url": "https://api.github.com/users/jczaplew/gists{/gist_id}", "repos_url": "https://api.github.com/users/jczaplew/repos", "avatar_url": "https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/u/1739551?v=3", "events_url": "https://api.github.com/users/jczaplew/events{/privacy}", "site_admin": false, "gravatar_id": "", "starred_url": "https://api.github.com/users/jczaplew/starred{/owner}{/repo}", "followers_url": "https://api.github.com/users/jczaplew/followers", "following_url": "https://api.github.com/users/jczaplew/following{/other_user}", "organizations_url": "https://api.github.com/users/jczaplew/orgs", "subscriptions_url": "https://api.github.com/users/jczaplew/subscriptions", "received_events_url": "https://api.github.com/users/jczaplew/received_events"}, "state": "open", "title": "Slow loading of table with large geometry objects", "labels": [{"id": 223714667, "url": "https://api.github.com/repos/jakob/Postico/labels/enhancement", "name": "enhancement", "color": "84b6eb", "default": true}], "locked": false, "number": 212, "assignee": null, "comments": 2, "html_url": "https://github.com/jakob/Postico/issues/212", "assignees": [], "closed_at": null, "milestone": null, "reactions": {"+1": 2, "-1": 0, "url": "https://api.github.com/repos/jakob/Postico/issues/212/reactions", "heart": 0, "laugh": 0, "hooray": 0, "confused": 0, "total_count": 2}, "created_at": "2016-05-02T20:04:48Z", "events_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/jakob/Postico/issues/212/events", "labels_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/jakob/Postico/issues/212/labels{/name}", "updated_at": "2016-05-25T11:13:33Z", "comments_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/jakob/Postico/issues/212/comments", "repository_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/jakob/Postico"}

title: Feature Request: Hide schemas in the GUI
body: Is there a way to _hide_ schemas in the GUI? We have a Redshift cluster with a _lot_ of different schemas and we want to hide `test_*` schemas and a few other unwanted schemas in the GUI. It will be really nice to have an option in the preferences to hide unwanted schemas, since Postgres does not provide a way to apply permissions in a way that can hide schemas.  At the moment, all the schemas are visible and when the user clicks on one of them, it alerts them that they don't have permission to view it.

title: Enhancement request: Preference to save valid queries only
body: Postico is a great product and I use it throughout my working day.  However, I end up with a lot of invalid SQL in the history (usually through typos).  Would it be possible to have a new preference: "Save valid SQL only" ? Thanks.

title: Save results for last X queries into a memory buffer to revisit without re-querying
body: Some implementation of tracking the last X queries is already implemented.  For each of those queries, you could save the results as a .csv into a .folder, and circularly replace them when the X-sized buffer is at its end.  This way if you ran a 120 second query, followed by a 5 second query, I could revisit the results of the 120 second query without re-executing it.

{"id": 154087318, "url": "https://api.github.com/repos/jakob/Postico/issues/216", "body": "Some implementation of tracking the last X queries is already implemented.

title: [bug] When delete few tables - no table list reloads
body: Hello.  Please fix a simple bug. When I select few tables and press Delete - it ask me to drop these tables. I select "Cascade" and tables deletes. But they still appear in the table list (centre area). Then I need manually press "refresh" button to update list of tables. Please trigger refresh table list when operation on delete tables completed.  Thanks. Anton
data:
{"id": 158781394, "url": "https://api.github.com/repos/jakob/Postico/issues/229", "body": "Hello.

Please fix a simple bug. When I select few tables and press Delete - it ask me to drop these tables. I select "Cascade" and tables deletes. But they still appear in the table list (centre area). Then I need manually press "refresh" button to update list of tables. Please trigger refresh table list when operation on delete tables completed.

title: Make "foreign key navigation" bi-directional
body: Currently Postico can follow a foreign key (open a "foreign key pop-up window") when browsing the table containing the foreign key, but the rverse is not true. e.g  table_a.id references table_b.id when browsing table_a, an icon is offered to pop-up table_b. when browsing table_b there is no icon to navigate to table_a. I suggest adding this.
data:
{"id": 160824534, "url": "https://api.github.com/repos/jakob/Postico/issues/233", "body": "Currently Postico can follow a foreign key (open a "foreign key pop-up window") when browsing the table containing the foreign key, but the rverse is not true.
e.g  table_a.id references table_b.id
when browsing table_a, an icon is offered to pop-up table_b.
when browsing table_b there is no icon to navigate to table_a.
I suggest adding this.

title: 'ORDER BY "ctid"' not  valid for Citus distributed database extension
body: Hello, a recently open-sources postgres extension, Citus, shards table data into a cluster of worker databases.  It is very slick.  The Postico client can connect to a citus master but when clicking on one of the tables gets an error:  "The server said: invalid attnum -1 for rangetable entry table_name"  This is due to the 'ORDER BY "ctid"' clause generated by Postico.  ctids are not valid for distributed tables are there would likely be many redundant values.  What is the purpose of the 'ORDER BY'?  Some guessing is that it provides the user with a more "stable" view of the table from run to run?  Does that buy much than just removing the order clause and returning rows in whatever order the database returns them?
data:
{"id": 161798882, "url": "https://api.github.com/repos/jakob/Postico/issues/234", "body": "Hello, a recently open-sources postgres extension, Citus, shards table data into a cluster of worker databases.  It is very slick.  The Postico client can connect to a citus master but when clicking on one of the tables gets an error:

"The server said: invalid attnum -1 for rangetable entry table_name"

This is due to the 'ORDER BY "ctid"' clause generated by Postico.  ctids are not valid for distributed tables are there would likely be many redundant values.  What is the purpose of the 'ORDER BY'?  Some guessing is that it provides the user with a more "stable" view of the table from run to run?  Does that buy much than just removing the order clause and returning rows in whatever order the database returns them?

title: Reverse engineering Entity-Relationship diagram from database feature
body: MySQL Workbench can reverse engineer an ER diagram from a table. I wish we had a similar feature in Postico.  I know this is a big feature to wish for and might not fall under the scope of Postico. I will be happy if anybody can point me to a decent tool that does ER digram from database. Please suggest something that you have experience with.

title: Resizing columns followed by reloading data resets all columns to default sizes
body: 1. Launch Postico, connect to a database, and open table to see its Content 2. Resize one or multiple columns in the table 3. Reload ( + R) or GUI reload button  Expected Result: Data is reloaded and column resizing is preserved Actual Result: Data is reloaded and columns are resized to defaults when first opening the table
data:
{"id": 165662406, "url": "https://api.github.com/repos/jakob/Postico/issues/240", "body": "1. Launch Postico, connect to a database, and open table to see its Content
2. Resize one or multiple columns in the table
3. Reload ( + R) or GUI reload button

Expected Result: Data is reloaded and column resizing is preserved
Actual Result: Data is reloaded and columns are resized to defaults when first opening the table

I downloaded the application from this link: https://eggerapps.at/postico/  ---  Specific repro steps: - Open Postico - Start new connection to a database - Double-click on the SQL Query option - Inside of the SQL Query pane, try to paste

title: Foreign key navigation N times
body: I find myself dealing with heavily related data and love the ability to open a referenced table. However I find myself wishing I could go N deep vs. just 1 layer. Maybe the new popup just replaces the current popup rather than N popups.

title: show triggers?
body: I'm not sure if I'm overlooking something obvious, but is there any way in Postico to view triggers or stored procedures on a given table?  I'm using Postico Version 1.0.8 (1442)

title: Debugger
body: Are there any plans of implementing a debugger mode into the app like in pgAdmin or there is one already?   Thats the only thing that prevents me from buying a license, I need the function debugger for work.  The pgAdmin's one isn't of course perfect, I cannot watch Record variables unless I print them as JSON or cast them to HStore).

title: Temporary table handling improvements
body: Use-case: Most of our users are not allowed to modify the database schema, but it's handy for them to create temporary tables to pre-process their data before e.g. inserting them.  Suggested improvements: - The "+ Table" view should have an option "[x] Temporary". Currently, you have to execute CREATE TEMPORARY TABLE SQL. - The sidebar currently shows `pg_temp_<some-number>`, it would be nice if these tables were shown in a virtual "Temporary" schema or ideally even at the top level.
data:
{"id": 173495743, "url": "https://api.github.com/repos/jakob/Postico/issues/259", "body": "Use-case:
Most of our users are not allowed to modify the database schema, but it's handy for them to create temporary tables to pre-process their data before e.g. inserting them.

Suggested improvements:
- The "+ Table" view should have an option "[x] Temporary". Currently, you have to execute CREATE TEMPORARY TABLE SQL.
- The sidebar currently shows `pg_temp_<some-number>`, it would be nice if these tables were shown in a virtual "Temporary" schema or ideally even at the top level.

title: "Dereference" and show name/label/title for foreign key fields on hover
body: After reading #248 I thought about how the usage of heavily normalised tables could be improved.   Clicking the popup button and then have your eyes search for the correct entry (and column) in the referenced table is a bit cumbersome. Maybe it would be possible to display the corresponding data directly over the cell on hover.  The logic could be as follows: - have a setting that is an ordered list of column names, that should be used for this display  a default might be `name`, `label`, `title`  - if a column is displayed and it is foreign key to a table that has one of these columns, the first of these (according to the order in the setting) is used in the overlay - when the cursor hits the first cell of a FK-column make a request like `SELECT "pk_column", "name" FROM "referenced_table" WHERE "pk_column" IN ($distinct_fk_values_displayed_on_current_page);` - put the data in a dictionary and then display the user identifiable data over the cell data itself, left of the open-fk-popup-button this way the users eyes will not have to move/search for the wanted information - there would be max 1 extra request per FK-column per page view  maybe you could restrict it to columns that have indexes to ensure that the queries will fast      What do you think about this?
data:
{"id": 173595575, "url": "https://api.github.com/repos/jakob/Postico/issues/260", "body": "After reading #248 I thought about how the usage of heavily normalised tables could be improved. 

Clicking the popup button and then have your eyes search for the correct entry (and column) in the referenced table is a bit cumbersome. Maybe it would be possible to display the corresponding data directly over the cell on hover.

The logic could be as follows:
- have a setting that is an ordered list of column names, that should be used for this display  a default might be `name`, `label`, `title` 
- if a column is displayed and it is foreign key to a table that has one of these columns, the first of these (according to the order in the setting) is used in the overlay
- when the cursor hits the first cell of a FK-column make a request like `SELECT "pk_column", "name" FROM "referenced_table" WHERE "pk_column" IN ($distinct_fk_values_displayed_on_current_page);`
- put the data in a dictionary and then display the user identifiable data over the cell data itself, left of the open-fk-popup-button this way the users eyes will not have to move/search for the wanted information
- there would be max 1 extra request per FK-column per page view  maybe you could restrict it to columns that have indexes to ensure that the queries will fast
  
  What do you think about this?

title: delete button for columns should not be to the right
body: If one has long table/column names the delete button is too far tot he right to easily tell which column will be marked for deletion.   ![long names](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/384993/18315402/30fd2696-7517-11e6-81b6-7017c0c9eb2a.png)

title: `on update` and `on delete` properties of foreign keys should be editable
body: Right now the foreign key has to be deleted and re-created. The UI could have the `on update` and `on delete` properties of the FK as editable and generate the proper `DROP CONSTRAINT / ADD CONSTRAINT` query.

title: the syntax highlighter should colour schemas, tables, columns, types, functions differently
body: This would make parsing what is going on in a query much easier. While it is not a problem when writing queries in the editor, where one can follow ones own indentation rules and aliasing/naming conventions, it is very hard to make sense of view definitions which don't preserve these. Most of the view definitions end up being mostly black text with some blue keywords.  ![view_definition](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/384993/18316271/41455f5c-751a-11e6-9b8b-a9aef96da9ec.png)

title: wrong ordering of results with alpha-num strings
body: I had an issue when manually sorting a result set with alpha-numerical transaction ids.  Here is reduced sample:  ``` SQL SELECT x  FROM unnest(ARRAY[   '0AH700', '1CH859', '2LP231', '3NM022', '03P758', '3SF762',    '4FP507', '5VW585', '6M8723', '7VP948', '9AK289', '15U924',    '39M313', '61W694', '75E749', '141925', '300280' ]) AS x; ```  ![wrong ordering](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/384993/18454025/5be4ff08-7942-11e6-8398-99bda691afb7.png)

title: Ed25519 support
body: I have recently switched my keys to Ed25519 for my SSL connections due to its speed and security. However, Postico doesn't seem to support them: ![Image](https://sijmenschoon.nl/_matrix/media/v1/download/sijmenschoon.nl/VvgcioGuEBeCFQClGGEZLiYs)

title: How do I add comment to a table/column?
body: This may sound stupid, but I can't seem to find a way to add a comment to a table in postico.  When I click on "+Column"  I can add `column name`, `type`, `default` and `constraints`.   I know I am asking a leading question but ability to add a comment seems obvious :)   Version info -  `Version 1.0.9 (1491)`

title: Parenthesis highlighting & debug messages
body: These may exist already, but I couldn't find where this setting would be enabled in the app.  The best part of postico is that it rarely crashes and it's very lightweight. I migrated from heavy pgadmin iii use because this provides a really slick interface and I can finally escape the pgadmin headaches and tableflipping with it's unstable query editor and frequent crashes.   However, what I think postico really needs is 1. parenthetical highlighting and 2. clearer debug messages. pgadmin iii has both of these and when working on debugging a complex SELECT query in the editor I find myself copying and pasting into pgadmin query editor to figure out if I have unbalanced parentheses and what position of the query is really causing issues (and why).  In short, parenthetical highlighting in the editor would go a long way in beefing up this app. I love doing scratch work and experimenting and exploring in postico, but this missing feature sucks. when the queries become sufficiently complex, it's good to be able to click the cursor at a certain parenthesis and have a visually indication in the query window which other parenthesis it is paired with it. Pgadmin does a great job with this and it's a feature that is oft taken for granted, but once it's gone you really wish you had it.  On a more minor note, the debug messages leave more to be desired. But this would be less of an issue with good query editor syntactic highlights for parenthetical imbalances.

title: Auto-Uppercase SQL Keywords
body: It would be nice to have an option to automatically uppercase SQL keywords.  This request is slightly related to #155 (auto-format SQL statements), but probably simpler to implement.

title: View Connection Settings while connection is active
body: At the moment it is not possible to view connection settings in the favorites window while Postico is connected to the server. It would be useful to show a read-only view even while connected.

title: Remember SQL Query divider position
body: The default position of the divider between the SQL query editor and the result view is near the top. It would be convenient if Postico remembered the position of this divider and wouldn't always reset it to the default position.

title: The shortcut for Filter should be F
body: F is not bound to anything in Postico, but it's the macOS conventional shortcut for finding things.  Is there a reason that F was chosen as the Filter shortcut instead?

title: Floating point comparison issue
body: When Postico creates update statements for tables without primary keys or for views, it compares the value of every row. When there are floating point columns, rounding issues can prevent rows from matching.  This causes errors like "the transaction did not affect the expected number of rows"  I have to investigate exactly how PostgreSQL compares floats, I'm not sure where this is s coming from.

This causes errors like "the transaction did not affect the expected number of rows"

I have to investigate exactly how PostgreSQL compares floats, I'm not sure where this is s coming from.

title: Feature request: favorite optimisation and db exports
body: Hello dear Postico creator,  As a frequent user I'd love to see a few ease of use updates.   Favorites bar - Groupable favorites (E.g. if you have an otap street way of working) - Searchbar for favorites (I have like 50+ databses) - Optimized scrolling when moving a DB. In my 50+ favorites moving one database favorite is absolute hell due to sensitive scrolling speed.   Database interface - A button to export an entire DB to whatever applicable file types. And vice versa. I've seen this request before, but this is my +1 I guess.  - Autocomplete for SQL queries would be wicked awesome.   If any could be added I'd be very grateful.   Thank you for a great product!  Jeroen
data:
{"id": 186228549, "url": "https://api.github.com/repos/jakob/Postico/issues/290", "body": "Hello dear Postico creator,

As a frequent user I'd love to see a few ease of use updates. 

Favorites bar
- Groupable favorites (E.g. if you have an otap street way of working)
- Searchbar for favorites (I have like 50+ databses)
- Optimized scrolling when moving a DB. In my 50+ favorites moving one database favorite is absolute hell due to sensitive scrolling speed. 

Database interface
- A button to export an entire DB to whatever applicable file types. And vice versa. I've seen this request before, but this is my +1 I guess. 
- Autocomplete for SQL queries would be wicked awesome. 

If any could be added I'd be very grateful. 

Thank you for a great product!

Jeroen

title: Feature Request: Copy Insert statement without primary key
body: This would be a nice option to have, as when you're copying data from production > staging, staging > local development etc, using the copy insert statement functionality, the fact that it includes the primary key can mess with the sequencing, as it does not update the sequence of the tables and causes other inserts to fail because it tries to an id that's next in the sequence but is already in use on the table. It can also be troublesome when you're trying to copy test data around and you're trying to insert rows with the ids that are already in use too, which means I have to write a tool to remove the ids from the insert statement.

title: Columns default width
body: When using `uuid` as a primary keys the db becomes hard to look at.  ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/115612/20419306/3fe4f914-ad88-11e6-9350-96eb9dbef6db.png)  You can make columns more narrow and Postico remembers the width for the duration of the current session but then after another launch they are having full-width again.   So I was thinking if storing view settings per each db might be not a viable option, maybe it is possible to add like default max-width for datatypes? After all, there is some trimming present as it is.

title: Can't delete an index on a table via UI
body: Consider this DDL:      DROP TABLE IF EXISTS my_table;     CREATE TABLE my_table      (   id                 serial     ,   title              varchar(100)     ,   isbn               varchar(13) NOT NULL     ,   copy_nr            integer NOT NULL     ,   PRIMARY KEY (id)     ,   UNIQUE (isbn, copy_nr)     );  To reproduce:  * run this SQL to create the table * reload (cmd+R) * select `my_table`, choose `Structure` * press the minus (`-`) button right of the index-definition * press save changes  expected:  * The index will be dropped.  actual:  * I get an error, the index can't be dropped because there is still a constraint (`PostgreSQL said: cannot drop index my_table_pkey because constraint my_table_pkey on table my_table requires it Hint: You can drop constraint my_table_pkey on table my_table instead.`). See  ![attached screen-shot](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1086388/20670701/71f6c2e4-b57a-11e6-8620-2575d96735d9.png)   The same goes for the composite-index.
data:
{"id": 192011644, "url": "https://api.github.com/repos/jakob/Postico/issues/296", "body": "Consider this DDL:

    DROP TABLE IF EXISTS my_table;
    CREATE TABLE my_table 
    (   id                 serial
    ,   title              varchar(100)
    ,   isbn               varchar(13) NOT NULL
    ,   copy_nr            integer NOT NULL
    ,   PRIMARY KEY (id)
    ,   UNIQUE (isbn, copy_nr)
    );

To reproduce:

* run this SQL to create the table
* reload (cmd+R)
* select `my_table`, choose `Structure`
* press the minus (`-`) button right of the index-definition
* press save changes

expected:

* The index will be dropped.

actual:
 * I get an error, the index can't be dropped because there is still a constraint (`PostgreSQL said: cannot drop index my_table_pkey because constraint my_table_pkey on table my_table requires it
Hint: You can drop constraint my_table_pkey on table my_table instead.`). See 
![attached screen-shot](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1086388/20670701/71f6c2e4-b57a-11e6-8620-2575d96735d9.png)


The same goes for the composite-index.", "user": {"id": 1086388, "url": "https://api.github.com/users/doekman", "type": "User", "login": "doekman", "html_url": "https://github.com/doekman", "gists_url": "https://api.github.com/users/doekman/gists{/gist_id}", "repos_url": "https://api.github.com/users/doekman/repos", "avatar_url": "https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/u/1086388?v=3", "events_url": "https://api.github.com/users/doekman/events{/privacy}", "site_admin": false, "gravatar_id": "", "starred_url": "https://api.github.com/users/doekman/starred{/owner}{/repo}", "followers_url": "https://api.github.com/users/doekman/followers", "following_url": "https://api.github.com/users/doekman/following{/other_user}", "organizations_url": "https://api.github.com/users/doekman/orgs", "subscriptions_url": "https://api.github.com/users/doekman/subscriptions", "received_events_url": "https://api.github.com/users/doekman/received_events"}, "state": "open", "title": "Can't delete an index on a table via UI", "labels": [], "locked": false, "number": 296, "assignee": null, "comments": 2, "html_url": "https://github.com/jakob/Postico/issues/296", "assignees": [], "closed_at": null, "milestone": null, "reactions": {"+1": 0, "-1": 0, "url": "https://api.github.com/repos/jakob/Postico/issues/296/reactions", "heart": 0, "laugh": 0, "hooray": 0, "confused": 0, "total_count": 0}, "created_at": "2016-11-28T13:54:41Z", "events_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/jakob/Postico/issues/296/events", "labels_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/jakob/Postico/issues/296/labels{/name}", "updated_at": "2016-11-28T14:11:20Z", "comments_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/jakob/Postico/issues/296/comments", "repository_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/jakob/Postico"}

title: Run query with parameters
body: In my Python-code (with sqlalchemy and psycopg2), I have queries like:  ```sql INSERT INTO my_table(title, isbn, copy_nr) VALUES(:title, :isbn, 1) ```  the parts `:title` and `:isbn` are parameters which are supplied by code.   I would be very handy, when parameters are detected, Postico would pop-up a window to enter values for those parameters (types would be needed to be specified too). Ideally, Postico would recognise if the same query was run, so it could remember the entered values and provide them as default values.  I've used this behaviour in TOAD, and it makes a developers life a little better :-)  Not sure if this fits in your philosophy about Postico.
data:
{"id": 192013197, "url": "https://api.github.com/repos/jakob/Postico/issues/297", "body": "In my Python-code (with sqlalchemy and psycopg2), I have queries like:

```sql
INSERT INTO my_table(title, isbn, copy_nr)
VALUES(:title, :isbn, 1)
```

the parts `:title` and `:isbn` are parameters which are supplied by code. 

I would be very handy, when parameters are detected, Postico would pop-up a window to enter values for those parameters (types would be needed to be specified too). Ideally, Postico would recognise if the same query was run, so it could remember the entered values and provide them as default values.

I've used this behaviour in TOAD, and it makes a developers life a little better :-)

Not sure if this fits in your philosophy about Postico.", "user": {"id": 1086388, "url": "https://api.github.com/users/doekman", "type": "User", "login": "doekman", "html_url": "https://github.com/doekman", "gists_url": "https://api.github.com/users/doekman/gists{/gist_id}", "repos_url": "https://api.github.com/users/doekman/repos", "avatar_url": "https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/u/1086388?v=3", "events_url": "https://api.github.com/users/doekman/events{/privacy}", "site_admin": false, "gravatar_id": "", "starred_url": "https://api.github.com/users/doekman/starred{/owner}{/repo}", "followers_url": "https://api.github.com/users/doekman/followers", "following_url": "https://api.github.com/users/doekman/following{/other_user}", "organizations_url": "https://api.github.com/users/doekman/orgs", "subscriptions_url": "https://api.github.com/users/doekman/subscriptions", "received_events_url": "https://api.github.com/users/doekman/received_events"}, "state": "open", "title": "Run query with parameters", "labels": [{"id": 223714667, "url": "https://api.github.com/repos/jakob/Postico/labels/enhancement", "name": "enhancement", "color": "84b6eb", "default": true}], "locked": false, "number": 297, "assignee": null, "comments": 8, "html_url": "https://github.com/jakob/Postico/issues/297", "assignees": [], "closed_at": null, "milestone": null, "reactions": {"+1": 0, "-1": 0, "url": "https://api.github.com/repos/jakob/Postico/issues/297/reactions", "heart": 0, "laugh": 0, "hooray": 0, "confused": 0, "total_count": 0}, "created_at": "2016-11-28T14:01:14Z", "events_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/jakob/Postico/issues/297/events", "labels_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/jakob/Postico/issues/297/labels{/name}", "updated_at": "2017-01-14T15:20:30Z", "comments_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/jakob/Postico/issues/297/comments", "repository_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/jakob/Postico"}

title: "Nested" tables list
body: Hello!  First let me just say how much I love Postico! Thank you for making a modern and powerful GUI for working in PostgreSQL.  I have a feature request.  One of the most beloved and powerful features that PostgreSQL offers is true native table inheritance.  My team and I have settled on a naming scheme that I think would be applicable to others as well, and shares a natural and known paradigm used today. Consider the following tables.  ``` vehicles vehicles/automotives vehicles/automotives/cars vehicles/automotives/bikes vehicles/aeroplanes vehicles/aeroplanes/fixed_wing vehicles/aeroplanes/rotary ```  I understand above is a bit of a silly example. It's not my place to pedal the benefits or proper architecture of table inheritance, I leave that up to the individual. However, a pattern like this is not unreasonable.  What I'd like to request is that Postico sense this naming paradigm (slashes to indicate hierarchy) and use some nested expandable tree view. As projects mature and become enterprise-level, the complexity of the database increases. This would help with organization!  ```  vehicles/    automotives/    aeroplanes/      * fixed_wing      * rotary ```  To be clear, parent tables would still be selectable, just as a directory today in modern file managers are.   Thanks for your consideration!  ~ Dale
data:
{"id": 193519209, "url": "https://api.github.com/repos/jakob/Postico/issues/300", "body": "Hello!

First let me just say how much I love Postico! Thank you for making a modern and powerful GUI for working in PostgreSQL.

I have a feature request.

One of the most beloved and powerful features that PostgreSQL offers is true native table inheritance.

My team and I have settled on a naming scheme that I think would be applicable to others as well, and shares a natural and known paradigm used today. Consider the following tables.

```
vehicles
vehicles/automotives
vehicles/automotives/cars
vehicles/automotives/bikes
vehicles/aeroplanes
vehicles/aeroplanes/fixed_wing
vehicles/aeroplanes/rotary
```

I understand above is a bit of a silly example. It's not my place to pedal the benefits or proper architecture of table inheritance, I leave that up to the individual. However, a pattern like this is not unreasonable.

What I'd like to request is that Postico sense this naming paradigm (slashes to indicate hierarchy) and use some nested expandable tree view. As projects mature and become enterprise-level, the complexity of the database increases. This would help with organization!

```
 vehicles/
   automotives/
   aeroplanes/
     * fixed_wing
     * rotary
```

To be clear, parent tables would still be selectable, just as a directory today in modern file managers are. 

Thanks for your consideration!

~ Dale", "user": {"id": 1700514, "url": "https://api.github.com/users/voltechs", "type": "User", "login": "voltechs", "html_url": "https://github.com/voltechs", "gists_url": "https://api.github.com/users/voltechs/gists{/gist_id}", "repos_url": "https://api.github.com/users/voltechs/repos", "avatar_url": "https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/u/1700514?v=3", "events_url": "https://api.github.com/users/voltechs/events{/privacy}", "site_admin": false, "gravatar_id": "", "starred_url": "https://api.github.com/users/voltechs/starred{/owner}{/repo}", "followers_url": "https://api.github.com/users/voltechs/followers", "following_url": "https://api.github.com/users/voltechs/following{/other_user}", "organizations_url": "https://api.github.com/users/voltechs/orgs", "subscriptions_url": "https://api.github.com/users/voltechs/subscriptions", "received_events_url": "https://api.github.com/users/voltechs/received_events"}, "state": "open", "title": ""Nested" tables list", "labels": [], "locked": false, "number": 300, "assignee": null, "comments": 2, "html_url": "https://github.com/jakob/Postico/issues/300", "assignees": [], "closed_at": null, "milestone": null, "reactions": {"+1": 0, "-1": 0, "url": "https://api.github.com/repos/jakob/Postico/issues/300/reactions", "heart": 0, "laugh": 0, "hooray": 0, "confused": 0, "total_count": 0}, "created_at": "2016-12-05T14:55:31Z", "events_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/jakob/Postico/issues/300/events", "labels_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/jakob/Postico/issues/300/labels{/name}", "updated_at": "2016-12-07T04:53:04Z", "comments_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/jakob/Postico/issues/300/comments", "repository_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/jakob/Postico"}

title: Pretty print for jsonb should be an option
body: Go to table view of a table with jsonb type, select a row, and open the right-side pane to see the row data vertically. In the jsonb field, there is a dropdown with three options: NULL, DEFAULT and Pretty Print JSON.  The Pretty Print JSON option makes no sense for JSONB, because the Pretty Printed version is not saved, just the data. However, pretty printed json is nice to have.  So my suggestion (feature request) is to make this a toggle-field to always show the data pretty printed (or not, depending if it's selected or not). Also, change detection should be on data level, not on string level (pretty printing jsonb is no change).   I think it would be a sensible default for this option to be stored on connection-level, so the option persists for all jsonb fields within that connection. Or maybe even on application level.

title: SSH Connection Fingerprint Mismatch
body: Hello! I just upgraded to Sierra and Postico is reporting a ssh fingerprint that's different from the one added to the known_hosts file. I think this has something to do with the newer sha256 hash default.  This is preventing me from connecting to any Postgres DBs via SSH. The solution was copying a saved version of the known_hosts entry from an older backup.

title: Add Connection Keep-Alive Support
body: A couple of users have reported issues that the connection drops after a certain time of inactivity. This can be caused by a number of reasons; a possible cause are Firewalls that automatically drop idle connections.  Postico reconnects automatically when the connection is lost. However, sometimes it can take a long time for Postico to detect that a connection is lost. This is especially true for SSH connections (#66). Reducing timeouts is not really an option, since it would cause issues when using Postico over slow connections.  I've tried to address this issue by adding a setting that preemptively disconnects from the server after a period of inactivity, but that has been causing issues with temporary tables and settings like `search_path` (#142).  I believe the best way to go forward is to add a Keep-Alive mechanism to Postico. This would ensure that connections aren't dropped by over-protective firewalls, and it would also allow Postico to detect a lost connection more quickly. Such a keep-alive can be implemented on various levels (TCP, SSH, PostgreSQL). I think the best way to implement it is on the highest level, ie. by sending a no-op query like `SELECT 1;` to the PostgreSQL server -- this way we can be sure everything works.  There is a potential downside to a Keep-Alive mechanism: If you have an unreliable connection with intermittent connectivity, Postico will close the connection, even if the connection issues are only temporary. (Real Live Example: I'm on a train, entering a tunnel. There is no connection inside the tunnel. If Postico tries to send a Keep-Alive query while the train is in the tunnel, it will think the connection is lost, and I will need to reconnect later. Without Keep-Alive, Postico wouldn't ever know that we drove through a tunnel)  Another disadvantage of Keep-Alives is that Postico would need to periodically run code, increasing idle CPU usage. However, I assume that sending a single command to the server eg. once per minute should have minimal impact.

This is especially true for SSH connections (#66). Reducing timeouts is not really an option, since it would cause issues when using Postico over slow connections.

I've tried to address this issue by adding a setting that preemptively disconnects from the server after a period of inactivity, but that has been causing issues with temporary tables and settings like `search_path` (#142).

I believe the best way to go forward is to add a Keep-Alive mechanism to Postico. This would ensure that connections aren't dropped by over-protective firewalls, and it would also allow Postico to detect a lost connection more quickly. title: Cmd-Return should apply filters
body: It would be nice if, in addition to "Return", "Cmd-Return" would also apply filters, so that you can use the same keyboard shortcut as in the SQL editor.

title: Ctrl+Enter inserts \u2028 instead of newline
body: Version 1.0.5 (1353) OS X (El Capitan) 10.11.3  Editing a text field in line and inserting newlines (via ctrl+enter, since enter and command+enter and shift+enter all don't work) inserts `\u2028` (Unicode Character 'LINE SEPARATOR') instead of a newline.  This caused me a mild headache, since various python json serializers (I'm using Django) treat this character differently. Why is it this way?

title: When filtering on a foreign-key column, show a popup to select a value
body: When opening a table, you can change the value in columns with a foreign-key constraint with a nice value lookup popup.  This would also be nice when filtering on a column with a foreign-key constraint.  ![schermafbeelding 2017-01-27 om 14 16 55](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1086388/22372206/a6b75746-e49b-11e6-94da-956b3daa51e0.png)

title: Composite foreign keys don't show up anywhere in the table structure.
body: Taking the following tables:  ``` create table a (id1 int, id2 int, primary key (id1, id2)); create table b (id1 int, id2 int, foreign key (id1, id2) references a (id1, id2)); ```  Looking at table `b` structure in postico doesn't show the foreign key that references table a.

title: Add support for Vertica
body: This is not an issue, but probably an opportunity to serve the Vertica customer base. The tool works beautifully with Vertica using SQL view. HP Vertica does not come with a GUI client and other ones out there (DBeaver, DBVisualizer) are not as cool, simple and fast as Postico. Ofcourse I am biased because I am not a heavy user of these other tools.  No Schema/Table view shows up when connecting to the Db `Postico[39519]: Failed to load children of <PGEDatabase: 0x7fa56c38a230>: Error Domain=at.eggerapps.Postico Code=1 "Query failed" UserInfo={PG_DIAG_SOURCE_FUNCTION=throwRelationDoesNotExist, PG_DIAG_SEVERITY=ERROR, PG_DIAG_MESSAGE_PRIMARY=Relation "pg_namespace" does not exist, NSLocalizedRecoverySuggestion=PostgreSQL said: Relation "pg_namespace" does not exist, PG_DIAG_SQLSTATE=42V01, query=SELECT oid, nspname, nspname = ANY (current_schemas(true)) AS is_on_search_path FROM pg_namespace, NSLocalizedDescription=Query failed, PG_DIAG_SOURCE_LINE=3328, PG_DIAG_SOURCE_FILE=/scratch_a/release/24526/vbuild/vertica/Catalog/CatalogLookup.cpp}`
data:

title: Always show SQL Query when searching for tables
body: When searching for tables, the 'SQL Query' item is used in the search as well. A QOL improvement would be so always show this, whatever you search for.  ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/13898980/22923973/b19a0a62-f2a3-11e6-837c-3fa0b1877ff8.png)

title: Indexes: add "Copy as SQL" button
body: Since plain old sql query for an index is gone in the latest release there are no way to copy any specific index (nor view it in its raw sql form). I'm (and thousands of other developers) surely more familiar with the standard sql notation. Proposal: add "copy as sql" button for indexes along with graphical representation  relevant: https://github.com/jakob/Postico/issues/34

title: Rename & duplicate database
body: The possibility to easily rename and/or duplicate a database.

title: Poor performance when a table has many indexes
body: When a table has many indexes (50 or more), Postico takes a very long time to display the table structure view. A beach ball is shown.  This is because of a performance problem with auto layout. (Auto Layout performance has improved significantly over the years, but it seems I'm running into a bad edge case).  Unfortunately this issue will take some time to fix, because rewriting the view code not to use auto layout is complicated.
